intro: Rhodiola pleurogynantha, commonly known as the Tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions. It is often found at elevations above 3,000 meters, where it thrives in cold, nutrient-poor soils. Rhodiola pleurogynantha is valued for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its efficacy.
